author: DamiLee
description: Astronauts spend months confined in tight habitats, where even a single guitar can transform the mood. Through gradual crew rotations and shared rituals, sterile bases start to feel like home. This is placemaking—turning the most isolated environments, even lunar habitats, into spaces filled with memory, warmth, and humanity. What makes a space feel alive to you?
title: What would your “music corner” be if you lived on the Moon?
